bin.util

Class PathsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • bin.util.PathsUtil

  • public class PathsUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility-Class specified on paths. You can see available tasks here:
    Link to function Task description
    realPath(String) Make real path from relative. Why I don't want to use Class.getResource(String)? If directory/file isn't nested in classpath - it returns null, because ClassLoader can't "get resource". My method doesn't use ClassLoader to make real path (only for getting directory of caller class) - so it works pretty well even if directory/file isn't nested in classpath.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • splitPath

        private static java.lang.String[] splitPath(java.lang.String path)
        Splits path fragments. For example, path (randomly selected, needed big nesting) 
        /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/jre/lib/ext/
        will be split to array 
        ["/", "usr/", "lib/", "jvm/", "java-8-oracle/", "jre/", "lib/", "ext/"]
        And Windows-Style path 
        C:/gcc/gcc-4.8.0/libjava/javax/xml/parsers
        will be split to array 
        ["C:/", "gcc/", "gcc-4.8.0/", "libjava/", "javax/", "xml/", "parsers"]
        Function also supports file names and you don't have to add slash at the end of string to say that last element is directory.
        Parameters:
        path - path to process
        Returns:
        array of path parts.

      • asCollection

        @SafeVarargs
private static <T> java.util.Collection<T> asCollection(T... array)
        Converts varargs or array to Collection (in fact - ArrayList).
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of items in collection and array
        Parameters:
        array - varargs or array of items
        Returns:
        converted array to collection.

      • getCallerClass

        private static java.lang.Class<?> getCallerClass(java.lang.Class<?> current)
        Returns class that called some method. In fact, it returns first class, whose name doesn't equal current's name.
        Parameters:
        current - class where this method is being called (e.g. Class.getClass() or &lt;ClassName&gt;.class)
        Returns:
        caller class.

      • realPath

        public static java.lang.String realPath(java.lang.String relative)
        Makes real path from relative. To read more description - see documentation for class.
        Parameters:
        relative - relative path to convert
        Returns:
        real path from relative.
